class.name: ShadowFormat
class.description: Represents the shadow formatting for a shape or text in Word.

properties.name: blur
properties.description: Specifies the blur level for a shadow format as a value between 0.0 and 100.0.

properties.name: context
properties.description: The request context associated with the object. This connects the add-in's process to the Office host application's process.

properties.name: foregroundColor
properties.description: Returns a ColorFormat object that represents the foreground color for the fill, line, or shadow.

properties.name: isVisible
properties.description: Specifies whether the object or the formatting applied to it is visible.

properties.name: obscured
properties.description: Specifies true if the shadow of the shape appears filled in and is obscured by the shape, even if the shape has no fill, false if the shadow has no fill and the outline of the shadow is visible through the shape if the shape has no fill.

properties.name: offsetX
properties.description: Specifies the horizontal offset (in points) of the shadow from the shape. A positive value offsets the shadow to the right of the shape; a negative value offsets it to the left.

properties.name: offsetY
properties.description: Specifies the vertical offset (in points) of the shadow from the shape. A positive value offsets the shadow to the top of the shape; a negative value offsets it to the bottom.

properties.name: rotateWithShape
properties.description: Specifies whether to rotate the shadow when rotating the shape.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Specifies the width of the shadow.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Specifies the type of shadow formatting to apply to a shape.

properties.name: transparency
properties.description: Specifies the degree of transparency of the shadow as a value between 0.0 (opaque) and 1.0 (clear).

methods.name: incrementOffsetX
methods.description: Changes the horizontal offset of the shadow by the number of points.

params.name: increment
params.description: The number of points to adjust.

methods.name: incrementOffsetY
methods.description: Changes the vertical offset of the shadow by the specified number of points.

params.name: increment
params.description: The number of points to adjust.

methods.name: load
methods.description: Queues up a command to load the specified properties of the object. You must call context.sync() before reading the properties.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides options for which properties of the object to load.

params.name: propertyNames
params.description: A comma-delimited string or an array of strings that specify the properties to load.

params.name: propertyNamesAndPaths
params.description: propertyNamesAndPaths.select is a comma-delimited string that specifies the properties to load, and propertyNamesAndPaths.expand is a comma-delimited string that specifies the navigation properties to load.

methods.name: set
methods.description: Sets multiple properties of an object at the same time. You can pass either a plain object with the appropriate properties, or another API object of the same type.

params.name: properties
params.description: A JavaScript object with properties that are structured isomorphically to the properties of the object on which the method is called.

params.name: options
params.description: Provides an option to suppress errors if the properties object tries to set any read-only properties.

methods.name: toJSON
methods.description: Overrides the JavaScript toJSON() method in order to provide more useful output when an API object is passed to JSON.stringify(). (JSON.stringify, in turn, calls the toJSON method of the object that's passed to it.) Whereas the original Word.ShadowFormat object is an API object, the toJSON method returns a plain JavaScript object (typed as Word.Interfaces.ShadowFormatData) that contains shallow copies of any loaded child properties from the original object.

methods.name: track
methods.description: Track the object for automatic adjustment based on surrounding changes in the document. This call is a shorthand for context.trackedObjects.add(thisObject). If you're using this object across .sync calls and outside the sequential execution of a ".run" batch, and get an "InvalidObjectPath" error when setting a property or invoking a method on the object, you need to add the object to the tracked object collection when the object was first created. If this object is part of a collection, you should also track the parent collection.

methods.name: untrack
methods.description: Release the memory associated with this object, if it has previously been tracked. This call is shorthand for context.trackedObjects.remove(thisObject). Having many tracked objects slows down the host application, so please remember to free any objects you add, once you're done using them. You'll need to call context.sync() before the memory release takes effect.
